text: Me watching continually speculative cable news yammering about the Mueller report after repeated news reports said it was coming in December AND January AND February...

text: . @AndrewGillum on @RonDeSantisFL: “He reduced those areas in the early phases that would divide. He tacked a little more toward a pragmatic and less ideological place, and that has produced some good will for the governor.” Via @AsteadWesley
author: davecatanese

text:
If you're polling in single digits in a field of 15, and you get an hour on cable, you need to come armed for bear WITH NEWS.

A new policy position, a concrete contrast with Trump, or a buzzy line that kills.

Can't afford to waste the moment & just treat it as a campaign stop.
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren gives voters a question for her opponents:

"Ask them where they've been and how they've gotten their funding.

I don't go behind closed doors with people of money and influence to try to get their help in this election. I come here to be with you."
author: davecatanese

text: . @ewarren appears uninterested in raising the gas tax: "What worries me is it falls hardest on working people."
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren's wheelhouse:

"We get a 2% tax on the 75,000 richest families in this country, we would have enough money to provide universal child care, universal pre-K, universal pre-pre K, for every child in America and still have $2 TRILLION left over. Let's make it happen!"
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren thinks Confederate celebrations from federal lands should be removed and put in museums.

Also says Mississippi needs a new state flag.
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren, gets her most sustained applause for the night for this >

"Get rid of the electoral college."
author: davecatanese

text: . @ewarren's answer on her Native American ancestry flap is now basically . . . The voters don't care. I've moved on.
author: davecatanese

text: . @ewarren pretty darn strong tonight and her answer about family hardship -- "when you got to do something to take care of the people you love, you reach down you find it and you pull it up" -- was one of the most emotive responses I've seen her give.
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren tells her audience that they should think of affordable housing like they do health care:

"Having a decent and save place to live should be a basic human right."
author: davecatanese

text: . @ewarren says "There could be a temporary role" for private insurance in her Medicare for All vision.
author: davecatanese

text: Striking that for all her concrete policy planks, @ewarren does not have a preference on how to achieve Medicare for All. Speaks of "lots of pathways," getting everybody to the table to achieve universal coverage at lowest possible cost.
author: davecatanese

text: fun fodder for the next MAGA rally
author: davecatanese

text:
. @ewarren in MISSISSIPPI calls for a . . . congressional panel>

"I believe it's time to start the full blown national conversation on reparations in this country."

Says she supports a congressional panel to study it.
author: davecatanese

text:
. @SenGillibrand's answer on Franken tonight is that he could've chose to fight.

"He could've stuck it out, stayed in the Senate, gone through his Ethics Committee investigation for as long as he wanted . . . He could've SUED all of the 8 women who came out against him."
author: davecatanese

text:
. @SenGillibrand on the allegations from a staffer in her office:

"Her allegations did not rise to sexual harassment but we did find evidence of derogatory comments. The person that she alleged these against was punished."
author: davecatanese

text:
. @SenGillibrand's biggest sustained applause lines of the night so far in Michigan town hall with @chrislhayes: "One of the problems with President Trump is Betsy DeVos."

cc: @laurenonthehill

text:
. @SenGillibrand proposes that anyone who is unemployed or underemployed would get access to job training in some form.

Unclear on what that would cost.

text: . @SenGillibrand in one of her more fiery moments: "There's a difference between capitalism and greed and the line is when a gun manufacturer says 'I want to sell this weapon to anyone at any cost and not care that it results in children dying on a park bench in Brooklyn.'"
author: davecatanese

text:
. @SenGillibrand to @chrislhayes on her past A rating from the @NRA:

"On guns I should have done more. I regret not caring about other communities . . . I should have cared more about ending gun violence in other places."

TEXAS has put up a presidential candidate in every cycle since 1988.

'88: George H.W. Bush
'92: George H.W. Bush
'96: Phil Gramm
'00: George W. Bush
'04: George W. Bush
'08: Ron Paul
'12: Rick Perry, Ron Paul
'16: Ted Cruz, Rick Perry
'20: BETO

text:
I think you need to separate the "fanfare" with "better press"

He certainly dominated the day with 24-7 all medium coverage.

But it wasn't all positive. Lots of progressives on air&in quotes have been cutting him down.

That's part of the coverage cycle too. Not all fawning.
author: davecatanese

text:
O'Rourke really wanted to dip his toes in the Mississippi River. 

“I just don’t feel like you can come this close to it and not,” O’Rourke said.

His staff said no, he groaned.

“All right, then,” he conceded. “Some future visit we’ll do that.”
author: davecatanese

text:
